│ │                                                         │ 1).                                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - S2: Two progress towards the sequence (last two rolls │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ were 1-2).                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - S3: Success (last three rolls were 1-2-3).            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We need to find the probability that the process ends   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (success) on an odd number of steps. So, starting from  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S0, we need to model the transitions and calculate the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability that we end in S3 on an odd number of       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ trials.                                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ I think I can model this using a Markov chain with      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ absorbing states S3 and transient states S0, S1, S2.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The transitions between these states would depend on    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the die rolls.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define the probabilities for each transition.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ First, from S0:                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - If she rolls a 1, she moves to S1.                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - If she rolls anything else (2-3, 4, 5, 6), she stays  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ in S0.                                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, the transition probabilities from S0 are:           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S0 -> S1) = 1/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S0 -> S0) = 5/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S1:                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - If she rolls a 2, she moves to S2.                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - If she rolls a 1, she goes back to S0.                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Rolling any other number (3,4,5,6) keeps her in S1.   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, transition probabilities from S1:                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S1 -> S2) = 1/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S1 -> S0) = 1/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S1 -> S1) = 4/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S2:                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - If she rolls a 3, she reaches S3 (success).           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - If she rolls a 1, she goes back to S1.                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Rolling 2,4,5,6 keeps her in S2.                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, transition probabilities from S2:                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S2 -> S3) = 1/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S2 -> S1) = 1/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - P(S2 -> S2) = 4/6                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Our goal is to find the probability that starting from  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S0, we reach S3 on an odd number of steps.              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Hmm, how can I model this? Maybe I can define two       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities: one for being in S0 and S1 or S2 at even │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ steps, and another for being in S0 and S1 or S2 at odd  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ steps. Then, set up equations based on transitions and  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ solve for the probability of ending on an odd step.     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Let P_even be the probability of being in S0 when the │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ number of steps is even.                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Let P_odd be the probability of being in S0 when the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ number of steps is odd.                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, perhaps define Q_even and Q_odd for the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ states S1 and S2.                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe it's better to think in terms of expected   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ values or recursive equations. Alternatively, perhaps   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ using generating functions or recurrence relations.     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, since the problem is about parity (odd   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ or even number of steps), maybe I can model it with     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ states that track the parity. Let me think:             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Define two states: O and E, where O is the state when   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the number of rolls is odd, and E when it's even. But   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the transitions should keep track of the progress       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ towards the sequence.                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But I need to define transitions from O and E to O and  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ E, considering the possible moves. Hmm, maybe that's    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ more complicated.                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, let me consider that each step can be    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ either odd or even, so perhaps define variables         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ representing the probabilities of being in each state   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ at even and odd steps.                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let p_even be the probability of being in S0 at an even │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ number of steps, and p_odd be the probability of being  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ in S0 at an odd number of steps.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, define q1_even and q1_odd for S1, and        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ q2_even and q2_odd for S2.                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But this might get too complicated with so many         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ variables. Maybe a better approach is to set up linear  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ equations for the probabilities.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me try that.                                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S0, after one step:                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 1/6, we go to S1.                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 5/6, we stay in S0.                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, if we start at S0 (which is even step 0), after one │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ step (odd step 1), we have a 1/6 chance to be in S1,    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and a 5/6 chance to be in S0.                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, from S1:                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S1 at even step, after one step (odd step), we can │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ go to S2 with 1/6, back to S0 with 1/6, or stay in S1   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ with 4/6.                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, from S2, at even step, after one step (odd   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ step), we can go to S3 with 1/6 (success), back to S1   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ with 1/6, or stay in S2 with 4/6.                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, but S3 is an absorbing state, so once we reach    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3, we don't leave.                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, perhaps the process can be modeled as a Markov      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ chain with states S0, S1, S2, and S3, where S3 is       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ absorbing. We can set up equations for the probability  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ of being absorbed at S3 starting from each state, and   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ then separate the even and odd steps.                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But this might be quite involved. Alternatively, since  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the problem is about the parity of the step count,      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ perhaps I can model the number of ways to reach S3 on   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ odd steps versus even steps, considering the number of  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ steps.                                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, another approach is to use the concept of states  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ with even and odd step counts. That is, define two      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ states: one for each progress state S0, S1, S2, labeled │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ as even and odd steps. But this might complicate        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ things.                                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe we can assign variables to the              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities of being in each state at even steps and  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ odd steps, and set up equations accordingly.            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me try this approach.                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Let p_even be the probability of being in S0 at an    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ even step.                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Let p_odd be the probability of being in S0 at an odd │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ step.                                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, define q1_even, q1_odd for S1, and q2_even,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ q2_odd for S2.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But this is getting too complicated with so many        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ variables. Maybe another way is to think about the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ expected number of steps, but since we need the         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability, perhaps it's better to use recursive       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ equations.                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps we can model this as a two-state system:  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ whether the current step is even or odd, and track the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let's try defining variables:                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let E be the probability of being absorbed at S3        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ starting from S0 at even steps.                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let O be the probability of being absorbed at S3        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ starting from S0 at odd steps.                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, define E1 for S1 at even steps and O1 for S1 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ at odd steps, and E2 for S2 at even steps and O2 for S2 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ at odd steps.                                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But this might become too unwieldy. Maybe instead,      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ consider that the probability of being absorbed at S3   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ on an odd step is equal to the probability of being in  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S2 at an odd step times the probability of              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ transitioning to S3 from S2, plus the probability of    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ being in S1 at an odd step times the probability of     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ transitioning to S2 and then to S3, and so on.          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps it's better to use recursion.             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let f(n) be the probability of being absorbed at S3 in  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ exactly n steps.                                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We need to compute the sum over all odd n of f(n).      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But n can be 3,5,7,...                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Hmm, but maybe we can express f(n) in terms of previous │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, perhaps using generating functions. Let  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ me think.                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, let me think about the process as a      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Markov chain with absorbing state S3. The other states  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ are transient.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Then, the probability of being absorbed at S3 starting  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ from S0 is some value, say, a. Similarly, the           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability of being absorbed at S3 starting from S1 is │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ b, and starting from S2 is c.                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But since we need the probability of being absorbed at  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3 on an odd step, perhaps we can compute the           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ difference between the probability of being absorbed at │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3 at an odd step and the probability at an even step.  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let me think of it as f_O, the probability of     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ being absorbed at S3 on an odd step, and f_E, the       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability on an even step. We need f_O.               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But since the process starts at S0, which is even step  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 0.                                                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps I can model the absorption probabilities  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ with parity.                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define two absorbing probabilities: f_O and f_E, │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ where f_O is the probability of being absorbed at S3 on │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ an odd step, and f_E is the probability on an even      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ step.                                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But starting from S0, at step 0 (even), the probability │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ of being absorbed at S3 is f_E.                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We need to find f_O.                                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But how do we relate f_O and f_E?                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S0, after one step (odd), we can be in S1 or stay  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ in S0. So, f_O = P(S0 -> S1) * f_O_prev + P(S0 -> S0) * │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ f_E_prev.                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe it's better to write equations based on     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ transitions.                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S0:                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - At the next step (odd), probability to be in S1: 1/6  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - Probability to stay in S0: 5/6                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, from S1:                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - At the next step, 1/6 chance to be in S2              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - 1/6 chance to go back to S0                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - 4/6 chance to stay in S1                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S2:                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - 1/6 chance to be absorbed at S3                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - 1/6 chance to go back to S1                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - 4/6 chance to stay in S2                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, starting from S0, which is our initial state.       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define variables:                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let x be the probability of being absorbed at S3 on an  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ odd step starting from S0.                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, y be the probability of being absorbed at S3 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ on an odd step starting from S1.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ z be the probability of being absorbed at S3 on an odd  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ step starting from S2.                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Our target is x.                                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Now, we can write equations based on the transitions:   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S0, at the next step:                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 1/6, we go to S1                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 5/6, we stay in S0                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, x = (1/6)*y + (5/6)*x                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, from S1, at the next step:                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 1/6, we go to S2                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 1/6, we go back to S0                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 4/6, we stay in S1                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, y = (1/6)*z + (1/6)*x + (4/6)*y                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ From S2, at the next step:                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 1/6, we are absorbed                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 1/6, we go back to S1                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - With probability 4/6, we stay in S2                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So, z = (1/6)*0 + (1/6)*y + (4/6)*z                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, since being absorbed at S3 is an event that ends  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the process, so from S2, with probability 1/6, we reach │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3 (absorbed), which contributes 1 to the probability,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ but actually, since we're only tracking the parity,     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ maybe it's better to model the probabilities as         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ fractions.                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps instead of 1 being the probability, we    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ model the absorption as 1, but in terms of              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe I need to think differently. Since we're    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ only interested in the parity, perhaps we can model the │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities as fractions of the total probability.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps another approach: since each step has a   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 1/6 chance to transition to a new state, and a 5/6      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ chance to stay in the same state, we can model the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ absorption probabilities with recurrence relations.     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let f(n) be the probability of being absorbed at S3 in  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ exactly n steps, starting from S0.                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, f_O is the sum over odd n of f(n), and f_E   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ is the sum over even n of f(n).                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Our goal is to find f_O.                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We can set up a recurrence relation for f(n). But this  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ might get complicated, so maybe using generating        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ functions or another method.                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, let me think about the expected number   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ of steps to reach S3. But that might not help with the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ parity.                                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, another idea: Since the process is memoryless,    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the absorption probabilities at S3 can be modeled using │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ linear algebra with transition matrices.                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me try defining the transition matrix between the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ transient states S0, S1, S2, and the absorbing state    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3.                                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The transition matrix would have 1s on the diagonal for │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3, and the other states will have their transition     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities.                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But since we're interested in the absorption            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities on odd steps, maybe we can partition the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ states into even and odd steps.                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps it's better to use the concept of         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability generating functions, but I'm not sure.     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps I can model this as a system of           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ equations. Let me see.                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ At any step, the probability of being in S0 is p0, S1   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ is p1, S2 is p2, and being absorbed at S3 is 1 - p0 -   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ p1 - p2.                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But we need to track the parity.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps I can define equations based on whether   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the current step is even or odd.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote:                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let E be the probability of being absorbed at S3 on an  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ even step.                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let O be the probability of being absorbed at S3 on an  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ odd step.                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We start at step 0, which is even, so E is the          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability of being absorbed at S3 at step 0, which is │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 0, since we start there.                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, but we are considering the parity of the number   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ of rolls, so starting at step 1, which is odd.          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, this is getting confusing. Maybe I should think   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ in terms of the number of steps.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me try a different approach. Let me define f(n) as  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the probability of being absorbed at S3 at step n.      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We need to find the sum over all odd n of f(n).         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The recurrence relation is:                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ f(n) = transition_prob(S0, n) * f(n-1) +                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ transition_prob(S1, n) * f(n-1) + transition_prob(S2,   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ n) * f(n-1)                                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, no, actually, the transitions depend on the       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ previous state.                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe it's better to model this as a system where │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the absorption probability at step n depends on the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ absorption probabilities at step n-1.                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But I'm not sure.                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps using the concept of probability          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ generating functions. Let me define G(x) =              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ sum_{n=0}^\infty f(n) x^n.                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Our target is the sum of coefficients for x^n where n   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ is odd.                                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But I'm not sure how to compute that.                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, perhaps I can use the fact that the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probability generating function for the absorption      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ times can be related to the transition probabilities.   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe I need to give up and look for another      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ method. Wait, I recall that for absorbing Markov        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ chains, the absorption probabilities can be found using │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the fundamental matrix.                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But since we are interested in the parity, maybe we can │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ adapt the fundamental matrix to track even and odd      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ steps.                                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, perhaps I can compute the expected       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ number of steps and use that to find the probability,   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ but I don't think that's directly helpful.              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps I can model the problem as two separate   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ processes: one that only takes even steps and one that  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ only takes odd steps.                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me define E as the probability of being absorbed at │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ S3 at even steps, and O as the probability at odd       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ steps.                                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Then, we can set up equations based on transitions      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ between these states.                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, starting from S0 at even step 0, which is even,   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ so E starts at 0.                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, no, starting at S0 at even step 0, which is the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ initial state. The first step is odd.                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe it's better to think of E and O as the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ probabilities after one step.                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps it's not straightforward, and I need to   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ accept that this might take too long.                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe a better approach: Let me think about the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ number of ways to reach S3 on an odd number of steps,   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ considering the number of rolls.                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But I'm not sure.                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, another idea: Since the target is 1-2-3, perhaps  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the number of steps to reach it is at least 3. So, n >= │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 3.                                                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The parity of n is what we care about. So, n can be     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 3,5,7,...                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We need the sum of probabilities where n is odd.        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote p(n) as the probability of reaching S3 at │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ step n.                                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Then, p(n) = P(n-1) * transition(n, S3)                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But we need the sum over n odd of p(n).                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But how to compute this.                                │                      │                    │ │
