│ │                                                         │ problem interpretation, maybe the problem expects the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ answer in this form, even though 35 and 9 are not       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ integers with sqrt(5005). But wait, the problem says x  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ = p - q√r where p, q, r are positive integers. Here,    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (35 - sqrt(5005))/9 is not of that form. Therefore, I   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ must have made a mistake somewhere.                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps I messed up the signs when solving for    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ t₂.                                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let's revisit the equations for t₂.               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For the internal tangent of C₂ and C₃ with negative     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ slope. The line is y = m x + b, m < 0.                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Distance from (12,0) is 2, and from (24,0) is 4.        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So:                                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |12m + b| = 2 sqrt(m² + 1)                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |24m + b| = 4 sqrt(m² + 1)                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ If we assume that the line is below the x-axis, then    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12m + b and 24m + b are negative. Therefore,            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - (12m + b) = 2 sqrt(m² + 1)                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - (24m + b) = 4 sqrt(m² + 1)                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let’s denote m = -k where k > 0. Then:                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - (-12k + b) = 2 sqrt(k² + 1) ⇒ 12k - b = 2 sqrt(k² +   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 1)                                                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly,                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - (-24k + b) = 4 sqrt(k² + 1) ⇒ 24k - b = 4 sqrt(k² +   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 1)                                                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Subtract first equation from second:                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12k = 2 sqrt(k² + 1)                                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Multiply both sides by 1/2:                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 6k = sqrt(k² + 1)                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Square:                                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 36k² = k² + 1 ⇒ 35k² = 1 ⇒ k = 1/sqrt(35)               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, m = -1/sqrt(35), and substituting back into  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12k - b = 2 sqrt(k² + 1):                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12*(1/sqrt(35)) - b = 2*sqrt(36/35) = 12/sqrt(35)       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Thus:                                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12/sqrt(35) - b = 12/sqrt(35) ⇒ b = 0                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, so the line is y = -x/sqrt(35), which passes      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ through the origin? But the distance from (0,0) to this │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ line is zero, but C₁ is at (0,0) with radius 1.         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ However, t₂ is only required to be a tangent to C₂ and  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ C₃, not C₁. So that's okay. The line y = -x/sqrt(35) is │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ tangent to C₂ and C₃ but passes through C₁. But since   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ it's only a tangent to C₂ and C₃, that's acceptable.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, but perhaps the line is supposed to be above the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x-axis? If we assume that 12m + b and 24m + b are       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ positive, then:                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12m + b = 2 sqrt(m² + 1)                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 24m + b = 4 sqrt(m² + 1)                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Subtracting:                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12m = 2 sqrt(m² + 1) ⇒ 6m = sqrt(m² + 1)                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But m is negative, so 6m is negative, sqrt(m² + 1) is   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ positive. Thus, this would lead to a contradiction,     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ since LHS is negative and RHS is positive. Therefore,   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the only valid solution is when the line is below the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x-axis, leading to b = 0.                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But if b = 0, the line is y = -x/sqrt(35), passing      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ through the origin. But origin is the center of C₁ with │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ radius 1. The distance from (0,0) to this line is zero, │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ which is less than the radius 1. Therefore, the line    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ passes through C₁, which would mean it's not just a     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ tangent to C₂ and C₃ but actually intersects C₁.        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ However, the problem states that t₂ is a common         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent to C₂ and C₃. It doesn't say anything  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ about C₁, so even if it intersects C₁, it's still a     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ valid tangent for C₂ and C₃. But geometrically, is this │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ possible?                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let's visualize. C₁ is at (0,0) with radius 1, C₂ │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ at (12,0) with radius 2, C₃ at (24,0) with radius 4.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The line y = -x/sqrt(35) starts at the origin and goes  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ down to the right with a negative slope. At x=12, y =   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ -12/sqrt(35) ≈ -12/5.916 ≈ -2.028, which is below C₂'s  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ center at (12,0), and the distance from C₂ to the line  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ is 2, which is equal to its radius, so the line is      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ tangent to C₂. Similarly, at x=24, y = -24/sqrt(35) ≈   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ -4.056, which is below C₃'s center at (24,0), and the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance from C₃ to the line is 4, equal to its radius, │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ so it's tangent to C₃. However, the line passes through │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (0,0), which is the center of C₁, so the distance from  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ C₁ to the line is zero, but C₁ has radius 1, so the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ line is actually passing through C₁'s center, not just  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ tangent. But the problem only requires t₂ to be a       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ common internal tangent to C₂ and C₃, so even though it │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ passes through C₁'s center, it's still a valid tangent  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ for C₂ and C₃. Therefore, the calculation is correct.   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the intersection point is at x = (35 -       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ sqrt(5005))/9. The problem states that x = p - q√r      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ where p, q, r are positive integers. However, in this   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ expression, p = 35/9, which is not an integer. This     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ suggests a mistake. Wait, perhaps the error lies in the │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ initial assumption that b = sqrt(m² + 1) for t₁. Let's  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ revisit that.                                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For t₁, common internal tangent with positive slope.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ We assumed that the intercept b was positive, leading   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ to b = sqrt(m² + 1). However, if the line is an         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent, perhaps it's located between the two  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ circles, so the intercept could be negative? Wait, but  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ with positive slope, starting from the lower left       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (negative x, negative y) to upper right (positive x,    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ positive y). If it's an internal tangent between C₁ and │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ C₂, which are on the x-axis from 0 to 12, the tangent   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ line should be above the x-axis, so intercept should be │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ positive.                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, maybe the internal tangent is below the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x-axis, but since the slope is positive, going from     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ lower left to upper right, but passing between the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ circles. However, since the circles are on the x-axis,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the internal tangent below the x-axis would have to dip │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ under the x-axis, but since the radii are 1 and 2, the  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance from the centers to the line must be 1 and 2   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ respectively. If the line is below the x-axis, then the │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance would still be positive, so the calculation    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ would proceed similarly.                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let's re-examine the sign when calculating the    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance for t₁.                                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For t₁, if the line is below the x-axis, then the       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ y-intercept b would be negative. However, since it's a  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ common internal tangent with positive slope, I think    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ it's supposed to be above the x-axis. Let me confirm.   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Imagine two circles on the x-axis, C₁ at (0,0) with     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ radius 1 and C₂ at (12,0) with radius 2. A common       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent with positive slope would start from   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the upper part of C₁ (right side) and go up to the left │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ part of C₂ (left side). Wait, no, with positive slope,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ it would go from lower left to upper right. But for     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent, it must lie between the circles.      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, this is confusing.                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, perhaps the internal tangent is above    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the line connecting the centers. Let's consider the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ external and internal tangents. For external tangents,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the lines lie outside the space between the circles,    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ while internal tangents cross between them. For two     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ circles on the x-axis, an internal tangent with         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ positive slope would have to cross from the upper part  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ of the left circle to the lower part of the right       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ circle, but since it's internal, maybe it's actually    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ closer to the line connecting the centers.              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, maybe it's better to use another method. The      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent lines can be found by offsetting the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ line connecting the centers by the radii. For two       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ circles, the internal tangent lines can be constructed  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ by drawing lines that are tangent to both circles and   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ lie between them. The slope of such a line can be found │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ using similar triangles.                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The line connecting the centers is along the x-axis     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ from (0,0) to (12,0). The difference in radii is 2 - 1  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ = 1. Wait, no, for internal tangent, the radii are      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ effectively subtracted. The distance between the        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ centers is 12. The angle θ of the tangent line with     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ respect to the line connecting the centers can be found │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ by tanθ = (r1 + r2)/d, but wait, for internal tangent,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ it's tanθ = (r1 - r2)/d? Wait, I need to recall the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ formula.                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Actually, for two circles with centers separated by     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance d, radii r1 and r2, the angle θ between the    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ line connecting the centers and the tangent lines is    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ given by:                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For external tangent: sinθ = (r1 + r2)/d                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For internal tangent: sinθ = |r1 - r2| /d               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let me check.                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Yes, for internal tangent, the angle is given by sinθ = │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |r1 - r2| / d, where θ is the angle between the line    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ connecting the centers and the tangent line.            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For C₁ and C₂: r1 = 1, r2 = 2, d = 12.                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So sinθ = |1 - 2| / 12 = 1/12                           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, θ = arcsin(1/12). Then, the slope of the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ tangent line would be tanθ.                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But since the tangent line is above the line connecting │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the centers, which is the x-axis, the slope is tanθ =   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 1/sqrt(12² - 1) = 1/sqrt(143). Which matches our        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ previous calculation. Therefore, the slope of the       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent is 1/sqrt(143), positive, as we found. │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the calculations are correct, and the        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ intercept is b = 12/sqrt(143), leading to the equation  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ y = (x + 12)/sqrt(143). Therefore, the intersection     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ with t₂ gives x = (35 - sqrt(5005))/9. The problem      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ states that x = p - q√r with p, q, r positive integers  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and r square-free. However, in our result, p would be   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 35/9, which is not an integer. This inconsistency       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ suggests there's a miscalculation somewhere.            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, perhaps I made a mistake in the algebra when      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ combining the terms. Let's go back to the intersection: │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ t₁: y = (x + 12)/sqrt(143)                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ t₂: y = -x/sqrt(35)                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Set equal:                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (x + 12)/sqrt(143) = -x/sqrt(35)                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Multiply both sides by sqrt(143) sqrt(35):              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (x + 12) sqrt(35) = -x sqrt(143)                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Then:                                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x sqrt(35) + 12 sqrt(35) = -x sqrt(143)                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Bring all terms to the left:                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x sqrt(35) + x sqrt(143) + 12 sqrt(35) = 0              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Factor x:                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x (sqrt(35) + sqrt(143)) = -12 sqrt(35)                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Thus:                                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x = -12 sqrt(35) / (sqrt(35) + sqrt(143))               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Yes, same as before. Multiply numerator and denominator │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ by (sqrt(35) - sqrt(143)):                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x = -12 sqrt(35) (sqrt(35) - sqrt(143)) / [ (sqrt(35))² │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ - (sqrt(143))² ]                                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Denominator: 35 - 143 = -108                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Numerator:                                              │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ -12 sqrt(35)*sqrt(35) + 12 sqrt(35)*sqrt(143) = -12*35  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ + 12 sqrt(5005) = -420 + 12 sqrt(5005)                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Thus:                                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ x = (-420 + 12 sqrt(5005))/(-108) = (420 - 12           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ sqrt(5005))/108                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Divide numerator and denominator by 12:                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (35 - sqrt(5005))/9                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So same result. Hence, no mistake detected.             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But the problem states that x is equal to p - q√r with  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ integers p, q, r. This suggests that maybe there's a    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ different approach or perhaps a miscalculation in the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ problem statement interpretation.                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, the problem says "common internal tangent to C₁   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and C₂ and has a positive slope", and similarly for t₂. │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Maybe my assumption about the internal tangent being    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ above the x-axis is incorrect.                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let's consider the internal tangent for C₁ and    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ C₂. If it's an internal tangent, it lies between the    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ two circles. So for C₁ at (0,0) and C₂ at (12,0), the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ internal tangent would be a line that touches both      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ circles and lies between x=0 and x=12. With positive    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ slope, it would rise from C₁ to C₂. Wait, but if it's   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ between them, maybe it's actually closer to the x-axis. │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, perhaps I should use homothety. The      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ homothety that sends C₁ to C₂ has center along the line │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ connecting their centers. The internal tangent would    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ correspond to the homothety that maps C₁ to C₂ with a   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ ratio of 2/1 = 2. The center of homothety lies on the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ line connecting the centers, which is the x-axis. The   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ center of homothety can be found by solving for the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ point (h, 0) such that the homothety with center (h, 0) │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ sends C₁ to C₂. The ratio is 2, so the distance from    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (h,0) to (12,0) is 2 times the distance from (h,0) to   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (0,0).                                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let me denote the distance from (h,0) to (0,0) as d.    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Then the distance from (h,0) to (12,0) is 12 - d. Given │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the ratio is 2, we have (12 - d)/d = 2 ⇒ 12 - d = 2d ⇒  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12 = 3d ⇒ d = 4. Therefore, the homothety center is at  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (h, 0) = (0 + d, 0) => h = d = 4. So the homothety      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ center is at (4,0).                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the internal tangent lines pass through      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (4,0). Wait, is this correct? If the homothety center   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ is at (4,0), then any tangent line resulting from the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ homothety should pass through (4,0).                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But we found the equation of t₁ as y = (x +             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12)/sqrt(143). Let's check if this line passes through  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (4,0).                                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Plugging x=4: y = (4 + 12)/sqrt(143) = 16/sqrt(143) ≈   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 16/11.958 ≈ 1.338. Not zero. Therefore, something is    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ wrong here.                                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Alternatively, maybe the common internal tangent does   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ not pass through the homothety center. Wait, homothety  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ maps the tangent line of C₁ to the tangent line of C₂,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ so the two tangent lines are mapped to each other, and  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ their intersection point is the homothety center.       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the two internal tangent lines (there are    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ two) intersect at the homothety center (4,0). But in    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ our case, we have only one internal tangent with        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ positive slope. Wait, there are two internal tangents,  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ one upper and one lower, but maybe in this case due to  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the positioning, only one has positive slope.           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But according to our previous calculation, t₁ does not  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ pass through (4,0), which contradicts the homothety     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ result. Therefore, there must be an error in the        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ calculation.                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, let's recast the problem. If the homothety center │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ is at (4,0), then the internal tangent lines pass       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ through (4,0). Therefore, the equation of the internal  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ tangent should pass through (4,0). Let's see.           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Assume that the internal tangent passes through (4,0)   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and has slope m. Then the equation is y = m(x - 4).     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ This line must be tangent to both C₁ and C₂.            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Distance from (0,0) to the line should be 1, and        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance from (12,0) to the line should be 2.           │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The line is y = m(x - 4), which can be written as mx -  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ y - 4m = 0.                                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Distance from (0,0):                                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |0 - 0 - 4m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = | -4m | / sqrt(m² + 1) =  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 4|m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = 1                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Distance from (12,0):                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |12m - 0 - 4m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = |8m| / sqrt(m² + 1) =   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 8|m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = 2                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ So we have two equations:                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 4|m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = 1                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 8|m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = 2                                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But 8|m| / sqrt(m² + 1) = 2 is exactly twice the first  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ equation, which is consistent. So from the first        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ equation:                                               │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 4|m| = sqrt(m² + 1)                                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Square both sides:                                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 16 m² = m² + 1 ⇒ 15 m² = 1 ⇒ m² = 1/15 ⇒ m =            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ ±1/sqrt(15)                                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Given that the slope is positive, m = 1/sqrt(15).       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the equation of the internal tangent is y =  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (x - 4)/sqrt(15).                                       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Wait, this contradicts our previous result. So where is │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the mistake?                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Earlier, we derived the tangent line as y = (x +        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 12)/sqrt(143), but using homothety, we get y = (x -     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 4)/sqrt(15). These are different lines. Which one is    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ correct?                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let's check the distance from (0,0) to y = (x -         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 4)/sqrt(15):                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Line: x/sqrt(15) - y - 4/sqrt(15) = 0                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Distance from (0,0):                                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |0 - 0 - 4/sqrt(15)| / sqrt( (1/sqrt(15))² + (-1)^2 ) = │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 4/sqrt(15) / sqrt(1/15 + 1) = 4/sqrt(15) / sqrt(16/15)  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ = 4/sqrt(15) * sqrt(15)/4 = 1. Correct.                 │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Distance from (12,0):                                   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |12/sqrt(15) - 0 - 4/sqrt(15)| / sqrt(1/15 + 1) =       │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ |8/sqrt(15)| / (4/sqrt(15)) = 8/4 = 2. Correct.         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the correct equation of the internal tangent │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ t₁ is y = (x - 4)/sqrt(15). So where was the mistake in │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the previous approach?                                  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Ah! Earlier, when solving for t₁, I assumed that the    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ intercept b was equal to sqrt(m² + 1), but that's only  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ valid if the line is in the form y = mx + b and the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance from (0,0) is 1. However, if the line passes   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ through (4,0), then the intercept is not simply sqrt(m² │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ + 1). Hence, the initial assumption was incorrect.      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Therefore, the correct approach is to use homothety or  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ consider that the internal tangent passes through the   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ homothety center (4,0). Therefore, the previous method  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ of assuming the line is y = mx + b and solving for m    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and b without considering the homothety center led to   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ an incorrect result.                                    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Similarly, for t₂, the common internal tangent to C₂    │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and C₃ with negative slope, the homothety center would  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ be between C₂ and C₃. Let's calculate that.             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ For C₂ (12,0) radius 2 and C₃ (24,0) radius 4, the      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ homothety center that maps C₂ to C₃ with ratio 4/2 = 2. │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The center of homothety lies on the line connecting     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ their centers (the x-axis). Let the center be at (h,0). │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ The ratio of distances from homothety center to the     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ centers is 2. So distance from (h,0) to (24,0) is twice │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ the distance from (h,0) to (12,0).                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let d be the distance from (h,0) to (12,0), then        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ distance to (24,0) is 24 - h. Given the ratio is 2:     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (24 - h)/d = 2                                          │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ But d = h - 12 (since h > 12 for the homothety center   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ to be between C₂ and C₃ or beyond). Wait, if the        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ homothety is internal, the center should be between C₂  │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ and C₃. Let me set up the equation.                     │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Let’s denote the distance from homothety center to C₂   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (12,0) as d, then the distance to C₃ (24,0) is 24 - h = │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 24 - (12 + d) = 12 - d. But the ratio is 4/2 = 2, so:   │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ (24 - h)/(h - 12) = 4/2 = 2                             │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ Solving:                                                │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 24 - h = 2(h - 12)                                      │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 24 - h = 2h - 24                                        │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │ 24 + 24 = 3h                                            │                      │                    │ │
│ │                                                         │                                                         │                      │                    │ │
